snippet: With a month to go in her re-election campaign, Chancellor Angela Merkel faces disdain from Germany’s intelligentsia and questions about American surveillance efforts.
abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel kicks off final phase of her campaign for reelection by visiting high school in former East Berlin and giving history lesson about Berlin Wall, building of which she experienced as little girl; visit is both uniquely personal appearance and part of effort to draw in youth.
lead_paragraph: With a month to go in her re-election campaign, Chancellor Angela Merkel faces disdain from Germany’s intelligentsia and questions about American surveillance efforts.

headline.main: Merkel Enters Last Leg of Re-election Bid With a Push to Draw In Youths
headline.print_headline: Merkel Enters Last Leg of Re-election Bid With a Push to Draw In Youths
